definition: to maintain/to adhere to/to observe (an injunction etc)
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: But after we had started to uphold the precept of not stealing, our lung and nose problesm will gradually diminish.
sentences.chinese: 當我們持守不偷盜戒後，肺部和鼻子只出些小毛病。

sentences.english: The same applies to upholding the sutras.
sentences.chinese: 這同樣適用於持守佛經。

sentences.english: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come.
sentences.chinese: 但你們已經有的，總要持守，直等到我來。

sentences.english: Then said his wife unto him, Dost thou still retain thine integrity?
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子對他說，你仍然持守你的純正嗎。

sentences.english: I want to hold onto the dream that you give me.
sentences.chinese: 我要堅定持守你賜給我的夢想。

sentences.english: If lords and princes could obey him, all things would abide by him.
sentences.chinese: 王侯若能持守他，萬物會自動歸順。

sentences.english: Only hold on to what you have until I come.
sentences.chinese: 但你們已經有的，總要持守，直等到我來。

sentences.english: In fact, these are just sociopolitical ideas I've held for years.
sentences.chinese: 實際上這也是我多年來一直持守的社會政治理念。

sentences.english: The person with strong desire cannot keep the vows and will be slandered a lot.
sentences.chinese: 大貪慾者，無法持守戒律，並多遭誹謗。

definition: (third person pronoun for a divine being)
the will of Heaven/the will of God
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
